meanings.definition: relating to or consisting of ossicles
meanings.sent1: The ossicular structure of the tiny bones was crucial for hearing.
meanings.sent2: The doctor examined the ossicular chain in the middle ear.
meanings.sent3: The ossicular connection between the bones resembled a delicate puzzle.
meanings.sent4: Her ossicular jewelry collection tinkled softly as she moved.
meanings.sent5: The ossicular nature of the bones made them fragile yet essential.

meanings.definition: pertaining to the small bones in the middle ear
meanings.sent1: The ossicular bones in the ear helped transmit sound vibrations.
meanings.sent2: The ossicular chain played a vital role in auditory function.
meanings.sent3: The ossicular bones danced to the rhythm of the music.
meanings.sent4: His ossicular hearing was so acute, he could hear a pin drop.
meanings.sent5: The ossicular bones were like tiny bridges carrying sound waves.
